channel.title: Ansgar - NEW UPDATES MUST SEE! 05-17-2012
channel.description:
[center]Ansgar Copyright © n-Development 2012[/center]
[b]Developers[/b]
Isaiah (Me) Brian (Coming to the forums soon)
[b]Introduction to Ansgar[/b]
Ansgar, previously known as "Project Silverlight", is going to be a complete remake of RuneScape in the 2006-2007 era. We are using the 39dll.dll for ultimate connection speed as well as Direct3D (D3D) and OpenGL. Please take note that we wan't to turn Ansgar into our complete own game eventually, but for now we just wan't it to bring back the good old days. Now because we do wan't to eventually turn it into our own game we will not be using the origional RuneScape graphics, names of towns, ect... The map, gameplay, skills, quests and what really makes RuneScape be RuneScape will all be the same. We just don't wan't to be sued. Sorry about the inconvenience, but we hope you understand.
[b]Server Development - Update 1[/b]
[b]While Ansgar is a Private Server it will be completely open source![/b]
We are nearly completed with the development of the server. We have it working as a number of tools for us which include; a server log, tells us which players are online and which world they are on (there are two worlds p2p and f2p), we can right click on a player to kick, ban, promote, or give items to directly, hosting of both worlds 1 and 2, and more (will keep some surprises for later :)).
[b]Client Development - Update 1[/b]
So far the client is blank, but it can connect to both worlds.
We are also developing a staff client which will enable any staff to modify the map right from the client!
So far this is what we have, but we will be keeping you updated :).
[b]Client Development - Update 2[/b]
We now have a basic beta client. You will see the images below. The dragon heads move as if breathing and follow the mouse. Also when you mouse over a menu item it swings down. Please let us know what you think!
[b]Client Images[/b]
Client [IMG]http://img803.imageshack.us/img803/4373/screenshot100l.png[/img]
[IMG]http://img29.imageshack.us/img29/3621/screenshot101l.png[/img]
[IMG]http://img196.imageshack.us/img196/1654/screenshot102ik.png[/img]
[IMG]http://img403.imageshack.us/img403/405/screenshot103sk.png[/img]

item.title: Ansgar - NEW UPDATES MUST SEE! 05-17-2012
item.dc:creator: @xEthanx xEthanx
item.description:
@xEthanx wrote:

So is this even going to be considered an RSPS? You say you’re going to make changes to the concept of the game entirely, but how drastic these changes are we don’t know, due to lack of pictures.

Because if this is a lot different, Onix is right… You may as well consider it a different kind of game and make it your own. Not like that’s a bad thing, to be honest that’s pretty badass.

Read full topic

item.title: Ansgar - NEW UPDATES MUST SEE! 05-17-2012
item.dc:creator: @eclipse_rsps eclipse rsps
item.description:
@eclipse_rsps wrote:

[quote=“n-Gen, post:14, topic:442320”][quote author=imsuperman05 link=topic=544955.msg4000455#msg4000455 date=1337911217]

Lol it is very ironic, but me and him know each other, I’m the server developer.

That’s not very ironic…

I do not follow your attempt into “not copying runescape, but still using their graphics, client, code, information but remaking runescape 2006”
[/quote]
Ok, we are using the Graphics, client, and etc… but we are re-designing the world, the gameplay, how you interact with the world most of the quests, and etc… Does that make sense?[/quote]
thats what a runescape private server is for… ugg facepam

Read full topic

item.title: Ansgar - NEW UPDATES MUST SEE! 05-17-2012
item.dc:creator: @n-Development n-Development
item.description:
@n-Development wrote:

This is what we are sticking with for now, but I’m sure we will change it in the future. The background is moving, the dragon heads move like they are breathing, the menu with the chains swing back and forth slightly, and when you mouse over a menu item the hover icon swings down. I know you cant tell from the images, but soon we will have a video once we have some gameplay.

Read full topic
